name: Maya - Kukulkan
subtitle: K'uk'ulkan- "Feathered Serpent" / "Quetzal-Serpent"
description:
The great feathered serpent is one of the most important deities of Mesoamerica, worshipped from the
                earliest Olmec civilizations through the Maya and Aztec empires. As K'uk'ulkan among the Yucatec Maya
                and Q'uq'umatz among the K'iche', this winged serpent god brought knowledge, civilization, and the
                sacred calendar to humanity. His descent as a serpent of light at Chichen Itza each equinox remains
                one of the world's most spectacular archaeoastronomical phenomena.

summary:
The great feathered serpent is one of the most important deities of Mesoamerica, worshipped from the

cultural_significance: A significant deity in mayan mythology, widely worshipped and culturally influential.
